                      Description
-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Â«Their first and only LP with the original bandname is now very rare and 
could be compared in style to ethno-prog band such as Maad (Italy) or 
Embryo (Germany). Released way back in 1974, the lone, self-titled effort
from Spirale is an album notable for its lack of electronic instruments.Â»

Â«It also has some of those loveable low-budget production flaws that are
so often heard in obscure 1970s Italian progressive music, and the bass 
(mostly an upright from what I can tell) quite often seems charmingly 
out-of-tune. But this was an earnest and quite energetic jazz-rock 
ensemble excursion, with excellent brass arrangements and improvisation.Â» 

Â«Other instruments used include violin,drums,piano and various percussion
instruments.There are some folk overtones on "Paparoncino," and the brief
but pretty "Una Baliato per Yanes" seems to come as much from Vince 
Guaraldi as Dave BrubeckÂ» by Reginod, wagoÂ»
